quote: Once you learn to read, you will be forever free.
author: Frederick Douglass

quote: There are many little ways to enlarge your world.  Love of books is the best of all.
author: Jacqueline Kennedy

quote: Reading is a discount ticket to everywhere.
author: Mary Schmich

quote: Books are a uniquely portable magic.
author: Stephen King

quote: Books are the plane, and the train, and the road. They are the destination, and the journey. They are home.
author: Anna Quindlen

quote: One glance at a book and you hear the voice of another person, perhaps someone dead for 1,000 years. To read is to voyage through time.
author: Stephen King

quote: Reading is like thinking, like praying, like talking to a friend, like expressing your ideas, like listening to other people’s ideas, like listening to music, like looking at the view, like taking a walk on the beach.
author: Roberto Bolaño

quote: Reading was a joy, a desperately needed escape — I didn’t read to learn, I was reading to read.
author: Christian Bauman

quote: A book is a garden, an orchard, a storehouse, a party, a company by the way, a counselor, a multitude of counselors.
author: JCharles Baudelaire

quote: The books transported her into new worlds and introduced her to amazing people who lived exciting lives.
author: Roald Dahl

quote: Reading… a vacation for the mind…
author: Dave Barry

quote: Reading is the sole means by which we slip, involuntarily, often helplessly, into another’s skin, another’s voice, another’s soul.
author: Joyce Carol Oates

quote: A reader lives a thousand lives before he dies, said Jojen. The man who never reads lives only one.
author: George R.R. Martin

quote: Keep reading. It’s one of the most marvelous adventures that anyone can have.
author: Lloyd Alexander

quote: Each book was a world unto itself, and in it I took refuge.
author: Alberto Manguel

quote: Books are not about passing time. They’re about other lives. Other worlds. Far from wanting time to pass, one just wishes one had more of it.
author: Alan Bennett

quote: I leapt eagerly into books. The characters’ lives were so much more interesting than the lonely heartbeat of my own.
author: Ruta Sepetys

quote: Reading changes your life. Reading unlocks worlds unknown or forgotten, taking travelers around the world and through time. Reading helps you escape the confines of school and pursue your own education.
author: Donalyn Miller

quote: We may sit in our library and yet be in all quarters of the earth.
author: John Lubbock

quote: Books and doors are the same thing. You open them, and you go through into another world.
author: Jeanette Winterson

quote: It is not true that we have only one life to live; if we can read, we can live as many more lives and as many kinds of lives as we wish.
author: S.I. Hayakawa

quote: It is what you read when you don’t have to that determines what you will be when you can’t help it.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Books are the quietest and most constant of friends; they are the most accessible and wisest of counselors, and the most patient of teachers.
author: Charles William Elliot

quote: Books are mirrors: you only see in them what you already have inside you.
author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón

quote: No book is really worth reading at the age of ten which is not equally – and often far more – worth reading at the age of fifty and beyond.
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: Reading furnishes the mind only with materials of knowledge; it is thinking that makes what we read ours.
author: John Locke

quote: The best books… are those that tell you what you know already.
author: George Orwell

quote: Show me a family of readers, and I will show you the people who move the world.
author: Napoléon Bonaparte

quote: Maybe this is why we read, and why in moments of darkness we return to books: to find words for what we already know.
author: Alberto Manguel

quote: Reading is an intelligent way of not having to think.
author: Walter Moers

quote: I don’t believe one reads to escape reality. A person reads to confirm a reality he knows is there, but which he has not experienced.
author: Lawrence Durrell

quote: Reading is going toward something that is about to be, and no one yet knows what it will be.
author: Italo Calvino

quote: You will learn most things by looking, but reading gives understanding. Reading will make you free.
author: Paul Rand

quote: You can never be wise unless you love reading.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Sleep is good, he said, and books are better.
author: George R.R. Martin

quote: She read books as one would breathe air, to fill up and live.
author: Annie Dillard

quote: I cannot remember the books I’ve read any more than the meals I have eaten; even so, they have made me.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: I can survive well enough on my own, if given the proper reading material.
author: Sarah J. Maas

quote: Reading is to the mind what exercise is to the body.
author: Joseph Addison

quote: Reading without reflecting is like eating without digesting.
author: Edmund Burke

quote: Ahhh. Bed, book, kitten, sandwich. All one needed in life, really.
author: Jacqueline Kelly

quote: Reading is a basic tool in the living of a good life.
author: Mortimer J. Adler

quote: Some say life is the thing, but I prefer reading.
author: Ruth Rendell

quote: Books are like oxygen to a deep-sea diver,’ she had once said. ‘Take them away and you might as well begin counting the bubbles.
author: Alan Bradley

quote: If one reads enough books one has a fighting chance. Or better, one’s chances of survival increase with each book one reads.
author: Sherman Alexie

quote: And read… read all the time… read as a matter of principle, as a matter of self-respect. Read as a nourishing staple of life.
author: David McCullough Jr.

quote: Books are both our luxuries and our daily bread.
author: Henry Stevens

quote: There are worse crimes than burning books. One of them is not reading them.
author: Joseph Brodsky

quote: In the case of good books, the point is not to see how many of them you can get through, but rather how many can get through to you.
author: Mortimer J. Alder

quote: Reading one book is like eating one potato chip.
author: Diane Duane

quote: A classic is a book that has never finished saying what it has to say.
author: Italo Calvino

quote: A good book is an event in my life.
author: Stendhal

quote: If you would tell me the heart of a man, tell me not what he reads, but what he rereads.
author: François Mauriac

quote: Reading brings us unknown friends.
author: Honoré Balzac

quote: Literature is the most agreeable way of ignoring life.
author: Fernando Pessoa

quote: What a blessing it is to love books as I love them; to be able to converse with the dead, and to live amidst the unreal!
author: Thomas Babington Macaulay

quote: Once you have read a book you care about, some part of it is always with you.
author: Louis L’Amour

quote: I owe everything I am and everything I will ever be to books.
author: Gary Paulsen

quote: To acquire the habit of reading is to construct for yourself a refuge from almost all the miseries of life.
author: W. Somerset Maugham

quote: No matter who you are, no matter where you live, and no matter how many people are chasing you, what you don’t read is often as important as what you do read.
author: Lemony Snicket

quote: Take a good book to bed with you  “author”:”  books do not snore.
author: Thea Dorn

quote: No entertainment is so cheap as reading, nor any pleasure so lasting.
author: Mary Wortley Montagu

quote: I can feel infinitely alive curled up on the sofa reading a book.
author: Benedict Cumberbatch

quote: A well-read woman is a dangerous creature.
author: Lisa Kleypas

quote: Read a thousand books, and your words will flow like a river.
author: Lisa See

quote: The reading of all good books is like conversation with the finest men of past centuries.
author: René Descartes

quote: Books can be dangerous. The best ones should be labeled ‘This could change your life.
author: Helen Exley

quote: My life is a reading list.
author: John Irving

quote: Literature is my Utopia.
author: Helen Keller

quote: Reading well is one of the great pleasures that solitude can afford you.
author: Harold Bloom

quote: To know a man’s library is, in some measure, to know a man’s mind.
author: Geraldine Brooks

quote: It is both relaxing and invigorating to occasionally set aside the worries of life, seek the company of a friendly book… from the reading of ‘good books’ there comes a richness of life that can be obtained in no other way.
author: Gordon B. Hinckley

quote: If a book is well written, I always find it too short.
author: Jane Austen

quote: We should read to give our souls a chance to luxuriate.
author: Henry Miller

quote: Never put off till tomorrow the book you can read today.
author: Holbrook Jackson

quote: Few things leave a deeper mark on the reader, than the first book that finds its way to his heart.
author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón

quote: You have to remember that it is impossible to commit a crime while reading a book.
author: John Waters

quote: I love the solitude of reading. I love the deep dive into someone else’s story, the delicious ache of a last page.
author: Naomi Shihab Nye

quote: Read. Read anything. Read the things they say are good for you, and the things they claim are junk. You’ll find what you need to find. Just read.
author: Neil Gaiman

quote: What a blessing it is to love books.
author: Elizabeth von Arnim

quote: To feel most beautifully alive means to be reading something beautiful, ready always to apprehend in the flow of language the sudden flash of poetry.
author: Gaston Bachelard

quote: An hour spent reading is one stolen from paradise.
author: Thomas Wharton

quote: I read my eyes out and can’t read half enough… the more one reads the more one sees we have to read.
author: John Adams

quote: I do not read a book; I hold a conversation with the author.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: The problem with a life spent reading is you know too much.
author: Josh Lanyon

quote: Some books are so familiar that reading them is like being home again.
author: Louisa May Alcott

quote: Not all readers are leaders, but all leaders are readers.
author: Harry Truman

quote: I think books are like people, in the sense that they’ll turn up in your life when you most need them.
author: Emma Thompson

quote: He that loves reading has everything within his reach.
author: William Godwin

quote: The importance of reading, for me, is that it allows you to dream. Reading not only educates, but is relaxing and allows you to feed your imagination  “author”:”  creating beautiful pictures from carefully chosen words.
author: Eric Ripert

quote: Reading is a gift. It’s something you can do almost anytime and anywhere. It can be a tremendous way to learn, relax, and even escape.
author: Richard Carlson

quote: I have never known any distress that an hour’s reading did not relieve.
author: Montesquieu

quote: Read. As much as you can. As deeply and widely and nourishingly and irritatingly as you can. And the good things will make you remember them, so you won’t need to take notes.
author: A.L. Kennedy

quote: When you lose yourself in a book the hours grow wings and fly.
author: Chloe Thurlow

quote: Literature is the art of discovering something extraordinary about ordinary people, and saying with ordinary words something extraordinary.
author: Boris Pasternak

quote: The world belongs to those who read.
author: Rick Holland

quote: This week I’ve been reading a lot and doing little work. That’s the way things ought to be. That’s surely the road to success.
author: Anne Frank

quote: Books can truly change our lives: the lives of those who read them, the lives of those who write them.
author: Lloyd Alexander
